browser-action.name: Type on text input: First Name
browser-action.description:
Type some text inside an element.
Possible parameters are: - selector (required): The selector is a string that point to the elements in the page. Several types of selector are supported: text, CSS, XPath... You can specify several selectors by adding multiple "selector" parameters to this action. The targeted element will match any of the selectors (OR operator). - text (optional): Text to type - encryptedText (optional): Text to type on a password input. - timeout (optional): Forces the timeout for that action in ms. - mode (optional): TYPE or FILL. Type is more realist, types keys one by one. Fill sends the whole string in one go. Default to FILL. - delay (optional): Adds delay between each keydown/keyup sequence in ms. Used only when mode TYPE is selected. Default to 100 - frameName (optional): Frame name - waitForNavigation.url (optional): Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. The URL being navigated to must match this pattern. - waitForNavigation.timeout (optional): Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. The navigation must occur within the specified timeout in milliseconds. - waitForNavigation.until (optional): Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. The navigation will be considered done when the specified state is reached. Allowed values are : LOAD, DOMCONTENTLOADED, NETWORKIDLE, COMMIT
